article.title: Locale support
article.simpara: Frhed user interface is in English by default. But the language can be changed to other languages for which translations have been contributed. Localization affects all visible texts in the user interface.

section.title: Installing localizations
section.para: Localizations are installed by selecting them in the installer. If some localization is missing you can run the installer again and select it.

Localizations can be also installed and updated by copying translation files to the Languages-subfolder in Frhed installation folder. All translation files have filename of [langcode].po. For example de.po for German translation file.

section.title: Selecting the Frhed interface language
section.para: Interface language can be selected from the View settings -dialog which is found from Options-menu. In bottom of the dialog there is a dropdown control which contains all installed translations. The language can be changed by opening the dropdown and selecting the language from the list.
After the language selection the interface language is changed. There is no need to re-start Frhed.
If the wanted language is not shown in the list it is not installed or simply not yet contributed. Check the latest installer if there are more languages available.

section.title: Reporting errors in translation
section.para: If you see an error in translation, please submit a bug report to our bug tracker. It would be great if you can provide or suggest a fix. It is also possible to discuss about translations in our discussion forums.

section.title: Submitting a new translation
section.para:
If you want to help us and translate Frhed to new language (not yet in above list) you should first read our translation documentation. The documentation is available:
via ViewVC from version control
downloading the latest source package and opening the document Docs/Developers/Translations.html
PO files used to translate Frhed do not require any special tools. But it is recommended to use tools described in the above mentioned document.
